Class UpdateAppointmentController

  • java.lang.Object
    • controller.UpdateAppointmentController
  • public class UpdateAppointmentController
extends java.lang.Object
    Controller for the UpdateAppointment form //FUTURE ENHANCEMENT// reduce code redundancy by making this class a subclass of AddAppointmentController and overriding the addAppointment method to update the database as opposed to adding to it.

        public void updateAppointment​(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
                       throws java.text.ParseException,
                              java.sql.SQLException,
                              java.io.IOException
        updates a selected appointment in the database
        Parameters:
        event - ActionEvent triggered by pressing "confirm" button
        Throws:
        java.text.ParseException - if date time is entered in incorrect format
        java.sql.SQLException - if error occurs during database connection or query execution
        java.io.IOException - if error occurs during input or output

      • isBusinessHours

        public boolean isBusinessHours​(javafx.scene.control.DatePicker date,
                               javafx.scene.control.TextField time)
                        throws java.text.ParseException
        checks if provided date time is inside the business hours of the company EST
        Parameters:
        date - DatePicker to extract date from
        time - TextField to extract time from
        Returns:
        true if outside business hours, false if inside business hours
        Throws:
        java.text.ParseException - if date and time are not entered in correct format

      • isOverlap

        public boolean isOverlap()
                  throws java.text.ParseException
        determines if a customer is already scheduled for an appointment at the selected times
        Returns:
        true if overlap exists, false if no overlap exists
        Throws:
        java.text.ParseException - if date time is not entered in correct format
